info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 10:38PM EDT until August 19 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana, including the following counties, St. Joseph and La Porte.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT /100 AM CDT/.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1036 PM EDT /936 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Bend, Michigan City, La Porte, Westville, Georgetown, Trail Creek, Gulivoire Park, North Liberty, New Carlisle, Long Beach, Lakeville, Roseland, Pottawattamie Park, Michiana Shores, Kingsbury, Indian Village, Byron, Rolling Prarie, Fish Lake and Stillwell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT /1 AM CDT/ TUESDAY

area.areaDesc: La Porte, IN; St. Joseph, IN
